result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott L Best was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety from controlled substances. 

NO contact with victims, D.S., W.B. and R.B.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Treatment, assessment, counseling as recommended by Department. 

DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
6 months MCJ
Concurrent with: each other and to any other sentence defendant is now serving
Unpaid court costs reduced to Civil Judgment.

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo:
Defendant appears in custody with Atty Shari Post;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves 15CM2090 Ct 2 (OWR) - D&RI; 16CM1482 Ct 1 (OWR) - D&RI; 17CM1582 Ct 2 (Battery), Ct 5 (DC) and Ct 6 (Battery)  -D&RI; 17CM1583 Ct 3 (Possess Drug Parapher) and Ct 4 (BJ-Misd) - D&RI; 18CF706 D&RI all counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7 -- Court Grants All.  
Off the record 9:06AM...B.O.R. 9:08 AM
PLEA: 15CM2090 Ct 1 (Possess THC) - No Contest; 16CM1482 Ct 2 (BJ-Misd) - No Contest; 17CM1582 Ct 1 (Battery) - No Contest; Ct 3 (DC) - No Contest; Ct 4 (DC) - No Contest; 17CM1583 Ct 1 (Resisting) - No Contest; Ct 2 (Possess THC) - No Contest;

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: SWH on all counts - 2 Years Probation on each count concurrent to one another.  Conditions: Treatment/assessment/counseling as recommended by dept; absolute sobriety from controlled substances and alcohol; n/c/w victims D.S., W.B., R.B., pay cc, provide DNA sample + surcharge.  Deft has 128 days credit on all counts.  Deft to meet with probation TODAY prior to release.

Adjourned: 9:17 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 24, 2018 at 09:00 am.
